title: Alexa+, Amazon’s AI assistant, is now available to everyone in the U.S.
summary: Amazon opens Alexa+ to everyone in the U.S. The AI feature is free for Prime members across devices, and free for everyone on mobile and web.

title: Accel doubles down on Fibr AI as agents turn static websites into one-to-one experiences
summary: Fibr AI replaces marketing agency– and engineering-heavy website personalization with autonomous systems designed for enterprise scale.

title: Exclusive: Positron raises $230M Series B to take on Nvidia’s AI chips
summary: The investment comes from backers including the Qatar Investment Authority as demand for chips beyond Nvidia soars and as Qatar aims to build out its AI infrastructure.

title: Intel will start making GPUs, a market dominated by Nvidia
summary: Intel has been bulking up a team to focus on this effort and will develop its GPU strategy around customer needs.

title: Xcode moves into agentic coding with deeper OpenAI and Anthropic integrations
summary: Xcode 26.3 offers agentic coding capabilities with Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex.

title: Lotus Health nabs $35M for AI doctor that sees patients for free
summary: This AI doctor is licensed in all 50 states, the startup says. The deal was led by CRV and Kleiner Perkins.

title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health
summary: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay aligned and address potential well-being issues.

title: Peak XV says internal disagreement led to partner exits as it doubles down on AI
summary: Peak XV is transitioning board roles and opening a U.S. office while continuing to view India as its largest market.

title: From guardrails to governance: A CEO’s guide for securing agentic systems

title: Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech
summary: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. summary: MIT Technology Review’s What’s Next series looks across industries, trends, and technologies to give you a first look at the future. You can read the rest of them here. Demand for electric vehicles and the batteries that power them has never been hotter. In 2025, EVs made up over a quarter of new vehicle sales globally,…

title: Anthropic says ‘Claude will remain ad-free,’ unlike ChatGPT
summary: Anthropic has announced that it won't be bringing ads to its AI chatbot Claude, in sharp contrast to confirmed plans from OpenAI to allow advertising in ChatGPT. To hammer the point home further, the company is releasing a Super Bowl commercial that makes fun of unnamed rivals adding adverts to their AI. "We want Claude […]

title: Sen. Warren wants to know what Google Gemini’s built-in checkout means for user privacy
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) is pressing Google for more information about its plans to build a checkout feature into its Gemini AI chatbot. In a letter to Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Warren expresses concerns that the integration could allow Google and retailers "to exploit sensitive user data" or "manipulate consumers into spending more and paying […]

title: Elon Musk is merging SpaceX and xAI to build data centers in space — or so he says
summary: On Monday, Elon Musk announced that he was merging two of his companies, SpaceX and xAI, in a deal said to be worth $1.25 trillion. The reason, Musk said in an announcement, was that in order for AI to grow, it needed to go to space. AI relies on "large terrestrial data centers" that run […]

title: Microsoft says it’s building an app store for AI content licensing
summary: Microsoft says it is working on the Publisher Content Marketplace (PCM), an AI licensing hub that shows usage terms set by publishers. That way, AI companies can easily shop the terms and set up deals to use online content for "grounding" their AI models, while the content owners get usage-based reporting to help set prices. […]

title: Apple’s Xcode adds OpenAI and Anthropic’s coding agents
summary: Apple is building OpenAI and Anthropic's AI-powered coding agents directly into Xcode. New integrations in Xcode 26.3 will give developers the ability to call upon Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex to write and edit code, update project settings, search documentation, and more. Xcode is the software developers can use to create and test apps […]

title: French police raid X’s Paris office as UK investigation continues
summary: A raid on X's Paris office was carried out by the Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit on Tuesday with Europol and French police as part of an ongoing investigation that expanded in July to include Grok. As previously reported by Reuters, Elon Musk and former X CEO Linda Yaccarino were also summoned for hearings in April. […]

title: Claude Code was down, forcing developers to take a long coffee break
summary: Anthropic's Claude AI models experienced a major outage today, impacting products like Claude Code. Developers were seeing a 500 error when trying to use Claude Code, and Anthropic said that it was seeing elevated error rates on its APIs "across all Claude models." Anthropic quickly identified the root cause and implemented a fix within around […]

title: Millions of books died so Claude could live
summary: When ChatGPT launched, in November of 2022, it started a race that almost immediately consumed the tech industry. OpenAI didn't invent the concept of AI, but most of the state-of-the-art technology was confined to research labs at companies and institutions around the world. Then, suddenly, it was everywhere. And better than anyone expected. So many […]

title: AI Bots Are Now a Signifigant Source of Web Traffic
summary: New data shows AI bots pushing deeper into the web, prompting publishers to roll out more aggressive defenses.

title: HHS Is Making an AI Tool to Create Hypotheses About Vaccine Injury Claims
summary: Experts worry Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s Health Department will use an internal AI tool to analyze vaccine injury claims in a way that furthers his anti-vaccine agenda.

title: I Infiltrated Moltbook, the AI-Only Social Network Where Humans Aren’t Allowed
summary: I went undercover on Moltbook and loved role-playing as a conscious bot. But rather than a novel breakthrough, the AI-only site is a crude rehashing of sci-fi fantasies.

title: ‘Fallout’ Producer Jonathan Nolan on AI: ‘We’re in Such a Frothy Moment’
summary: The Westworld showrunner thinks AI will be good for burgeoning filmmakers, but not for Hollywood blockbusters.

title: Elon Musk Is Rolling xAI Into SpaceX—Creating the World’s Most Valuable Private Company
summary: By fusing SpaceX and xAI—which acquired X last year—Elon Musk tightens his grip over technologies that shape national security, social media, and artificial intelligence.

title: HHS Is Using AI Tools From Palantir to Target ‘DEI’ and ‘Gender Ideology’ in Grants
summary: Since March of 2025, the Department of Health and Human Services has been using tools from Palantir and the startup Credal AI to weed out perceived alignment with “DEI” or “gender ideology.”

title: Jeffrey Epstein Had a ‘Personal Hacker,’ Informant Claims
summary: Plus: AI agent OpenClaw gives cybersecurity experts the willies, China executes 11 scam compound bosses, a $40 million crypto theft has an unexpected alleged culprit, and more.

title: I Let Google’s ‘Auto Browse’ AI Agent Take Over Chrome. It Didn’t Quite Click
summary: Auto Browse can shop for clothes, plan a trip, and buy tickets for you. Or at least, that’s the idea.

title: So yeah, I vibe-coded a log colorizer—and I feel good about it
summary: Some semi-unhinged musings on where LLMs fit into my life—and how I'll keep using them.

title: Nvidia's $100 billion OpenAI deal has seemingly vanished
summary: Two AI giants shake market confidence after investment fails to materialize.

title: The rise of Moltbook suggests viral AI prompts may be the next big security threat
summary: We don't need self-replicating AI models to have problems, just self-replicating prompts.

title: Notepad++ users take note: It's time to check if you're hacked
summary: Suspected China-state hackers used update infrastructure to deliver backdoored version.

title: AI agents now have their own Reddit-style social network, and it's getting weird fast
summary: Moltbook lets 32,000 AI bots trade jokes, tips, and complaints about humans.

title: Developers say AI coding tools work—and that's precisely what worries them
summary: Ars spoke to several software devs about AI and found enthusiasm tempered by unease.

title: County pays $600,000 to pentesters it arrested for assessing courthouse security
summary: Settlement comes more than 6 years after Gary DeMercurio and Justin Wynn's ordeal began.

title: Does Anthropic believe its AI is conscious, or is that just what it wants Claude to think?
summary: We have no proof that AI models suffer, but Anthropic acts like they might for training purposes.
